<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>1.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Financial Statements </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The financial statements of
AMD are set forth in Item 8 of this report on Form 10-K. The financial statements of Spansion Inc. are incorporated by reference in Item 8 from Exhibit 99.1, &#147;Consolidated Financial Statements of Spansion Inc. (excerpt from Spansion&#146;s 2006
Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2006)&#148; and Exhibit 99.2, &#147;Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements of Spansion Inc. (excerpt from Spansion&#146;s Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended September 30, 2007)&#148; attached to
this Form 10-K. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Other than Schedule II, Valuation and Qualifying Accounts, Exhibit 99.1, &#147;Consolidated Financial Statements of
Spansion Inc. (excerpt from Spansion&#146;s 2006 Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2006)&#148; and Exhibit 99.2, &#147;Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements of Spansion Inc. (excerpt from Spansion&#146;s Form 10-Q for the quarterly
period ended September 30, 2007)&#148; as of September 30, 2007 and for the three and nine months ended September 30, 2007 attached to this Form 10-K, all other schedules have been omitted because the required information is not present or is not
present in amounts sufficient to require submission of the schedules or because the information required is included in the Consolidated Financial Statements or Notes thereto. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2.</B></FONT></TD>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>SCHEDULE II </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Valuation and Qualifying Accounts </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Years Ended </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>December&nbsp;25,
2005,&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2006 and December&nbsp;29, 2007 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(In millions) </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.5
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>dex105.htm
<DESCRIPTION>OUTSIDE DIRECTOR EQUITY COMPENSATION POLICY
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Outside Director Equity Compensation Policy</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.5 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Outside Director Equity Compensation Policy </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Adopted March&nbsp;22, 2006 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Amended and
Restated as of May&nbsp;3, 2007 and November&nbsp;1, 2007 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. <U>General</U>. This Outside Director Equity Compensation Policy (the
&#147;Policy&#148;) is adopted by the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) in accordance with Section&nbsp;12 of the Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;). Capitalized but undefined terms used herein
shall have the meanings provided for in the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. <U>Board Authority</U>. Pursuant to Section&nbsp;12 of the Plan, the Board is
responsible for adopting a policy for the grant of Awards under the Plan to Outside Directors (as defined therein), which policy is to include a written, non-discretionary formula and also specify, with respect to any such awards, the conditions on
which such awards shall be granted, become exercisable and/or payable, and expire, and such other terms and conditions as the Board determines in its discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. <U>Equity Grants to Directors</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) <U>&#147;Off-Cycle&#148; Initial Grant</U>. On
the date of an Outside Director&#146;s initial appointment to the Board that occurs other than on the date of an annual meeting of the Company&#146;s stockholders at which Outside Directors are elected, such Outside Director shall be granted,
automatically and without necessity of any action by the Board or any committee thereof, the number of Restricted Stock Units, or RSUs, granted pursuant to this Policy to each Outside Director at the immediately preceding annual meeting of the
Company&#146;s stockholders (the &#147;Initial RSU Grant&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) <U>Annual Grant</U>. Provided that he or she has
served as a member of the Board continuously for at least six months prior to such date, each Outside Director shall be granted, automatically and without necessity of any action by the Board or any committee thereof, the number of RSUs, equal to
the quotient of (i)&nbsp;$225,000 divided by (ii)&nbsp;the Average Fair Market Value of a Share on the date of grant (rounded down to the nearest whole number) under the Plan (the &#147;Annual RSU Grant,&#148; together with the Initial RSU Grants,
the &#147;RSU Grants&#148;)) on the date of the annual meeting of the Company&#146;s stockholders where such Outside Director is elected, beginning with the annual meeting of the Company&#146;s stockholders held in 2007. For purposes of determining
the number of RSUs of the RSU Grant for 2007, each Outside Director shall be deemed to have been granted 10,000 RSUs as the RSU Grant for 2006. In the event that the number of RSUs of an RSU Grant in a current year is increased by more than 25% of
the number of RSUs granted pursuant to the RSU Grant in the previous year, the number of RSUs granted in the current year shall be equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;the number of RSUs granted pursuant to the previous year&#146;s RSU Grant and
(ii)&nbsp;125%. In the event that the number of RSUs of an RSU Grant in a current year is decreased by more than 25% of the number of RSUs granted pursuant to the RSU Grant in the previous year, the number of RSUs granted in current year shall be
equal to the product of (i)&nbsp;the number of RSUs granted pursuant to the previous year&#146;s Annual RSU and (ii)&nbsp;75%. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) <U>Average Fair Market Value</U>. For purposes of this Policy, &#147;Average Fair
Market Value&#148; means the average of the closing stock prices for the Shares for the 180 day period immediately preceding and ending with the date of grant of an Initial RSU Grant or Annual RSU Grant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. <U>Insufficient Shares</U>. Further, if there are insufficient Shares available under the Plan for each Outside Director who is eligible to receive an
RSU Grant (as adjusted) in any year, the number of Shares subject to each RSU Grant in such year shall equal the total number of available Shares then remaining under the Plan divided by the number of Outside Directors who are eligible to receive an
RSU Grant on such date, as rounded down to avoid fractional Shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. <U>Vesting</U>. Each RSU Grant shall vest and become exercisable
according to the following schedule: one-third on the first anniversary of the date of grant; one-third on the second anniversary of the date of grant; and one-third on the third anniversary of the date of grant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. <U>Deferral</U>. Each RSU represents the right to receive one Share upon vesting of such RSU. Receipt of the Shares issuable upon vesting of RSUs may
be deferred at the Outside Director&#146;s election; <B>provided</B>, that such deferral election is (i)&nbsp;in compliance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;) and the Department of Treasury
final regulations and guidance thereunder and (ii)&nbsp;pursuant to such terms and conditions as the Board may determine in its discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">7. <U>Termination of Service as an Outside Director</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) If an Outside Director&#146;s tenure on the Board is
terminated for any reason other than Misconduct, then the Outside Director or the Outside Director&#146;s estate, as the case may be, shall have the right for a period of twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months following the date such tenure is terminated to
exercise previously granted Options held by such Outside Director to the extent the Outside Director was entitled to exercise such Option on the date the Outside Director&#146;s tenure terminated; <B>provided</B> the actual date of exercise is in no
event after the expiration of the original term of the Option. An Outside Director&#146;s &#147;estate&#148; shall mean the Outside Director&#146;s legal representative or any person who acquires the right to exercise an Option by reason of the
Outside Director&#146;s death or Disability. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) If an Outside Director&#146;s tenure on the Board is terminated due to death,
Disability, or retirement from service, Awards granted pursuant to this Policy shall become fully vested and/or exercisable; <B>provided</B>, that such Outside Director shall have served as a member of the Board for at least three years prior to the
date of such termination and shall have satisfied the Company&#146;s equity ownership guidelines to the satisfaction of the Board during his or her service as a member of the Board. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8. <U>Effect of Change of Control</U>. Upon a Change of Control, all Awards held by an Outside Director shall become fully vested and/or exercisable,
irrespective of any other provisions of the Outside Director&#146;s Award Documentation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9. <U>Effect of Other Plan Provisions</U>. The
other provisions of the Plan shall apply to the Awards granted automatically pursuant to this Policy, except to the extent such other provisions are inconsistent with this Policy. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10. <U>Treatment of Awards Previously Issued Under the Plan; Continued Grants under Prior Policy</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) Prior to March&nbsp;22, 2006 and continuing until the implementation of this Policy as revised effective as of May&nbsp;3, 2007, the
Company issued Awards to Outside Directors. Those grants will continue to be governed by the terms of this Policy as in effect as of their date of grant; <B>provided</B>, <B>however</B>, that Section&nbsp;7(ii) of this Policy shall apply
retroactively to such awards previously granted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) With respect to any Outside Director appointed to the Board during
the twelve month period prior to May&nbsp;5, 2007, in addition to the RSU grants described above, such Outside Director shall continue to be granted the remaining &#147;First Options&#148; (as defined in this Policy as in effect immediately prior to
May&nbsp;3, 2007 (the &#147;Prior Policy&#148;)) to which he would be entitled under the Prior Policy without regard to the effectiveness of this Policy on May&nbsp;3, 2007 and such grants will continue to be governed by the terms of this Policy as
in effect prior to May&nbsp;3, 2007; <B>provided</B>, <B>however</B>, that Section&nbsp;7(ii) of this Policy shall apply retroactively to such awards previously granted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11. <U>Incorporation of the Plan</U>. All applicable terms of the Plan apply to this Policy as if fully set forth herein, and all grants of Awards hereby are subject in all respect to the terms of such Plan.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12. <U>Written Grant Agreement</U>. The grant of any Award under this Policy shall be made solely by and subject to the terms set forth in
a written agreement in a form to be approved by the Board and duly executed by an executive officer of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13. <U>Policy Subject
to Amendment, Modification and Termination</U>. This Policy may be amended, modified or terminated by the Board in the future at its sole discretion. No Outside Director shall have any rights hereunder unless and until an Award is actually granted.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Board hereby expressly reserves the authority to terminate this Policy during any year up and until the election of directors at a given annual meeting of stockholders. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14. <U>Section&nbsp;409A</U>. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in the Policy, if an Outside
Director has elected to defer the receipt of Shares issuable upon vesting pursuant to Section&nbsp;6 hereof and at the time of such Director&#146;s &#147;separation from service&#148; with the Company (as such term is defined in the Treasury
Regulations issued under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code) he or she is deemed by the Company to be a &#147;specified employee&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code, to the extent delayed issuance of any portion of the Shares
subject to an RSU to which he or she is entitled under the terms of such RSU or deferral election agreement is required in order to avoid a prohibited distribution under Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code, such portion of such Outside&#146;
Directors Shares shall not be issued prior to the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the expiration of the six-month period measured from the date of the his or her separation from service with the Company or (b)&nbsp;the date of his or her death. Upon the
expiration of the applicable Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) period, all Shares deferred pursuant to this Section&nbsp;14 shall be issued. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">15. <U>Effectiveness</U>. This policy as amended and restated shall become effective as of November&nbsp;1, 2007. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">*&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp; *&nbsp;&nbsp;* </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.13(B)
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>dex1013b.htm
<DESCRIPTION>FORM OF MANAGEMENT CONTINUITY AGREEMENT, AS AMENDED AND RESTATED
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Form of Management Continuity Agreement, as amended and restated</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.13(b) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES, INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Form of Amended and Restated </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Management Continuity Agreement </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Dear
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;)
considers the establishment and maintenance of a sound and vital management to be essential to protecting and enhancing the best interests of the Company and its stockholders. The Company recognizes that, as is the case with many publicly held
corporations, the possibility of a change of control may exist and that the uncertainty and questions which such possibility may raise among management may result in the departure or distraction of management personnel to the detriment of the
Company and its stockholders. Accordingly, the non-management members of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors have determined that it is imperative to be able to rely upon management&#146;s continuance and that appropriate steps should be taken to
reinforce and encourage the continued attention and dedication of members of the Company&#146;s management, including you, to their assigned duties without distraction in the face of the potentially disturbing circumstances arising from the
possibility of a change of control of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to induce you to remain in the employ of the Company under such circumstances,
this letter agreement sets forth the benefits which the Company agrees will be provided to you in the event there is a &#147;Change of Control&#148; of the Company under the circumstances described below. (&#147;Change of Control&#148; is defined in
Section&nbsp;1.) In addition, the Company is also willing to agree to provide you the benefits described herein in consideration of your agreement to the arbitration provisions set forth in Section&nbsp;14 hereof. This Agreement amends and restates
in its entirety the Management Continuity Agreement between you and the Company entered into as of <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> (the &#147;Prior Agreement&#148;). Upon the execution of this
Agreement by you and the Company it shall supersede the Prior Agreement and the Prior Agreement shall be of no further force or effect. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.
<B>Change of Control.</B> For purposes of this Agreement, a &#147;Change of Control&#148; shall mean a change of control of the Company of a nature which would be required to be reported in response to Item&nbsp;6(e) of Schedule 14A of Regulation
14A promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (&#147;Exchange Act&#148;) or in response to any other form or report to the Securities and Exchange Commission or any stock exchange on which the Company&#146;s shares are listed
which requires the reporting of a change of control. In addition, a Change of Control shall be deemed to have occurred if (i)&nbsp;any &#147;person&#148; (as such term is used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act) is or becomes the
beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing more than 20% of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities; or (ii)&nbsp;in any two year period, individuals who were members of
the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) at the beginning of such period plus each new director whose election or nomination for election was approved by at least two-thirds of the directors in office immediately prior to such election or
nomination, cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority of the Board, or (iii)&nbsp;a majority of the members of the Board in office prior to the happening of any event and who are still in office after such event, determines in its sole
discretion within one year after such event, that as a result of such event there has been a Change of Control. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing definition, &#147;Change of Control&#148; for purposes of this Agreement,
shall exclude the acquisition of securities representing more than 20% of the combined voting power of the Company by the Company, any of its wholly owned subsidiaries, or any trustee or other fiduciary holding securities of the Company under an
employee benefit plan now or hereafter established by the Company. As used herein, the term &#147;beneficial owner&#148; shall have the same meaning as under Section&nbsp;13(d) of the Exchange Act, and related case law. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. <B>Term.</B> This Agreement shall become effective immediately on the delivery of fully executed copies to both parties, and shall continue until
canceled pursuant to the notice of either party. Either party hereto may provide written notice to the other of cancellation of this Agreement, to take effect on the date specified in such notice, but in no event shall such cancellation take effect
less than two years from the date on which notice is given. Such notice shall be furnished in accordance with Section&nbsp;11 of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">3. <B>Tax Indemnity.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) If all or any portion of the amounts payable to you on your behalf under this Agreement or otherwise
are subject to the excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;) (or similar state tax and/or assessment), the Company shall pay to you an amount necessary to place you in the same
after-tax position as you would have been in had no such excise tax been imposed. The amount payable pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be increased to the extent necessary to pay income and excise taxes due on such amount. The determination
of the amount of any such tax indemnity shall initially be made by the independent accounting firm employed by the Company immediately prior to the Change of Control, or if such firm is unwilling to complete such calculations, such independent
accounting or consulting firm as the Company may select in its discretion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) If at a later date it is determined (pursuant to final
regulations or published rulings of the IRS, final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction or otherwise) that the amount of excise taxes payable by you is greater than the amount initially so determined, then the Company (or its successor)
shall pay you an amount equal to the sum of (1)&nbsp;such additional excise taxes (2)&nbsp;any interest, fines and penalties resulting from such underpayment, plus (3)&nbsp;any additional amount necessary to reimburse you for any income, excise or
other taxes payable by you with respect to the amounts specified in (1)&nbsp;and (2)&nbsp;above, and the reimbursement provided by this clause (3). If at a later date it is determined (pursuant to final regulations or published rulings of the IRS,
final judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction or otherwise) that the amount of excise taxes payable by you is lesser than the amount initially so determined, then you shall pay to the Company (or its successor) an amount equal to such
overpayment to the extent such is refunded to you. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) By signing this agreement, you and the Company both agree to cooperate with the person(s) calculating
the amount of the tax indemnity, and will provide copies of whatever tax returns and other documents may be necessary to perform the calculation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(d) Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, any payment required to be made under this Section shall be made no later than the end of the calendar year following the calendar year within which the taxes giving rise to such payment
obligation are remitted to the appropriate tax authorities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. <B>Termination of Employment Following Change of Control.</B> If any of the
events described in Section&nbsp;1 hereof constituting a Change of Control shall have occurred, you shall be entitled to the benefits provided in Section&nbsp;5 hereof upon the actual termination by the Company without Cause or &#147;Constructive
Termination&#148; of your employment that is a &#147;separation from service&#148; (within the meaning of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i)) within two years after such Change of Control (a &#147;Change of Control Termination&#148;), unless such
termination is by the Company for Cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <I><U>Constructive Termination</U>.</I> For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;Constructive
Termination&#148; shall mean a resignation by you due to any diminution or adverse change in the circumstances of your employment as determined in good faith by you, including, without limitation, your reporting relationships, job description,
duties, responsibilities, compensation, perquisites, office or location of employment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <I><U>Cause</U>.</I> For the purposes of this
Agreement, the Company shall have a &#147;Cause&#148; to terminate your employment if you are determined by a court of law or pursuant to arbitration under Section&nbsp;14 to have committed a willful act of embezzlement, fraud or dishonesty which
resulted in material loss, material damage or material injury to the Company. In such an event, you shall have no rights under this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(c) <I><U>Notice of Termination</U>.</I> Any termination of your employment by the Company or by you for any reason whatsoever during the term of this Agreement shall be communicated by written notice of termination to the other party
hereto (&#147;Notice of Termination&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) <I><U>Date of Termination</U>.</I> &#147;Date of Termination&#148; shall mean the date
specified in the Notice of Termination of your Change of Control Termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. <B>Benefits Upon Termination Following a Change Of
Control.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <I><U>Amount of Benefits</U>.</I> The Company shall provide to you as soon as practicable, but not more than ten business
days (subject to Section&nbsp;6, below) following a Change of Control Termination each of the following benefits: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)
<I>Severance Benefit.</I> The Company shall pay you a lump sum severance benefit which shall equal three times the sum of (A)&nbsp;your Base Compensation (as defined below), plus (B)&nbsp;the average of the two highest annual bonuses paid to you
during the last five full calendar years immediately prior to the Change of Control. For purposes of this </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;5(a)(1), &#147;Base Compensation&#148; means your rate of annual salary, as in effect for the twelve-month period ending on the date six months
prior to the Change of Control or on the Date of Termination, whichever is higher. Base Compensation does not include elements such as bonuses, reimbursement of interest paid on guaranteed loans, auto allowances, nor any income from equity based
compensation, such as may result from the exercise of stock options or stock appreciation rights, or the receipt of restricted stock unit awards or the lapse of restrictions on such awards. If you were employed by the Company and/or any of its
subsidiaries for less than one full calendar year immediately preceding the Change of Control, your &#147;highest annual bonus&#148; will be determined by annualizing the bonus earned during your period of employment as determined by the Company.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) <I>Equity Compensation.</I> All unvested stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock unit and restricted
stock awards held by you at the time of your Date of Termination shall be deemed fully vested and exercisable at such Date of Termination, as applicable. All vested options held by you, including those deemed fully vested as of the Date of
Termination shall become automatically exercisable for a period of one (1)&nbsp;year from the Date of Termination; provided, however, in no event shall any option remain exercisable beyond the maximum period allowed therefor in the stock option plan
or agreement under which it was granted, whichever is shorter. This agreement shall serve as an amendment to all of your outstanding stock options, restricted stock unit awards, restricted stock awards, stock appreciation rights and similar equity
compensation awards as of the date hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) <I>Accrued Bonus.</I> The Company shall pay you an amount equal to the pro
rata amount of the annual bonus accrued under the Company&#146;s Executive Bonus Plan for the portion of the year to the Date of Termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4) <I>Company Car.</I> The Company shall allow you the continued use of the Company automobile, on the same terms which existed prior to the Change of Control, for twelve (12)&nbsp;months following the Date of
Termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(5) <I>Financial and Tax Planning.</I> The Company shall reimburse you or pay directly for personal financial
planning and tax planning services up to $4,000 for twelve (12)&nbsp;months following the Date of Termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(6) <I>Other
Benefits.</I> The Company shall provide for a period of twelve (12)&nbsp;months following the Date of Termination, health and welfare benefits at least comparable to those benefits in effect on your Date of Termination, including but not limited to
medical, dental, disability, dependent care, and life insurance coverage. At the Company&#146;s election, health benefits may be provided by reimbursing you for the cost of converting a group policy to individual coverage, or for the cost of COBRA
premiums for the shorter of twelve (12)&nbsp;months or the applicable COBRA continuation period. The Company shall also pay you an amount calculated to pay any income taxes due as a result of the payment by the Company on your behalf for such health
benefits. Such tax payment shall be calculated to place you in the same after-tax position as if no such income had been imposed and shall be paid to you no later than the end of the calendar year following the calendar year in which such related
taxes are remitted to the appropriate tax authorities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <I><U>Other Benefits Payable</U>.</I> The benefits described in subsection (a)&nbsp;above shall be
payable in addition to, and not in lieu of, all other accrued or vested or earned but deferred compensation, rights, options or other benefits which may be owed to you following termination of your employment, irrespective of whether your
termination was preceded by a Change of Control, including but not limited to accrued vacation or sick pay, amounts or benefits payable under any employment agreement or any bonus or other compensation plans, stock option plan, stock ownership plan,
stock purchase plan, life insurance plan, health plan, disability plan or similar plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. <B>Section&nbsp;409A</B><B>.</B>
Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in the Agreement, if you are deemed by the Company at the time of your Date of Termination to be a &#147;specified employee&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code, to the extent
delayed commencement of any portion of the benefits to which you are entitled under this Agreement is required in order to avoid a prohibited distribution under Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) of the Code, such portion of your benefits shall not be
provided to you prior to the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the expiration of the six-month period measured from the date of the your &#147;separation from service&#148; (within the meaning of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i)) or (b)&nbsp;the date of your
death. Upon the expiration of the applicable Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i) period, all payments deferred pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6 shall be paid in a lump sum to you, and any remaining payments due under the Agreement shall be paid as
otherwise provided herein. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. <B>Payment Obligations Absolute. </B>The Company&#146;s obligation to pay the benefits described herein
shall be absolute and unconditional and shall not be affected by any circumstances, including, without limitation, any set-off, counterclaim, recoupment, defense or other right which the Company or any of its subsidiaries may have against you or
anyone else. In the event of any dispute concerning your right to payment, the Company shall nevertheless continue to pay to you your Base Compensation (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;5) until the dispute is resolved. Any such amounts paid
following your termination of employment shall be credited against the amounts otherwise due to you under this Agreement or, in the event the Company prevails, shall be repaid to the Company. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8. <B>Legal Fees.</B> The Company shall also pay forthwith upon written demand from you all legal fees and expenses reasonably incurred by you in seeking
to obtain or enforce any right or benefit provided by this Agreement. In the event you do not prevail in any ensuing arbitration or litigation, the Company shall absorb its own costs, expenses, and attorneys&#146; fees, and you shall reimburse the
Company for one-half of your costs, expenses, and attorneys&#146; fees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9. <B>Mitigation.</B> You shall not be required to mitigate the
amount of any payment provided for in this Agreement by seeking other employment or otherwise, nor shall the amount of any payment provided for in this Agreement be reduced or offset in any way whatsoever by any amount received by you for any reason
whatsoever from another employer or otherwise after the Date of Termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10. <B>Indemnification.</B> For at least six years following a Change of Control, you shall continue to
be indemnified under the Company&#146;s Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws at least to the same extent as prior to the Change of Control, and you shall be covered by the directors&#146; and officers liability insurance, the fiduciary liability
insurance and the professional liability insurance policies that are the same as, or provide coverage at least equivalent to, those the Company carried prior to the Change of Control. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11. <B>Successors; Binding Agreement.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(a) The Company will require any successor (whether direct or indirect, by purchase, merger, consolidation or otherwise) to all or substantially all of the business and/or assets of the Company, to expressly assume and agree to perform this
Agreement in the same manner and to the same extent that the Company would be required to perform it if no such succession had taken place. Failure of the Company to obtain such agreement prior to the effectiveness of any such succession shall be a
breach of this Agreement and shall entitle you to compensation from the Company in the same amount and on the same terms as you would be entitled hereunder if the Company had terminated your employment without Cause after a Change of Control, except
that for purposes of implementing the foregoing, the date on which any such succession becomes effective shall be deemed the Date of Termination. As used in this Agreement, &#147;Company&#148; shall mean the Company as hereinabove defined and any
successor to its business and/or assets as aforesaid which executes and delivers the agreement provided for in this Section or which otherwise becomes bound by all the terms and provisions of this Agreement by operation of law. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) This Agreement shall terminate upon your death except that if you should die while you are entitled to receive any amounts under this Agreement but
which are unpaid at your date of death, all such amounts, unless otherwise provided herein, shall be paid in accordance with the terms of this Agreement to your devisee, legatee, or other designee or, if there be no such designee, to your estate.
This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by your personal or legal representatives, executors, administrators, successors, heirs, distributees, devisees, and legatees. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">12. <B>Notice.</B> For the purposes of this Agreement, notices and all other communications provided for in the Agreement shall be in writing and shall
be deemed to have been duly given when delivered or mailed by the United States registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, addressed to the respective addresses set forth on the first page of this Agreement, provided that all
notices to the Company shall be directed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company with a copy to the Secretary of the Company, or such other address as either party may have furnished to the other in writing in accordance herewith,
except that notices of change of address shall be effective only upon receipt. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13. <B>Amendments.</B> No provisions of this Agreement may
be modified, waived or discharged unless such waiver, modification or discharge is agreed to in writing signed by you and the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer. No waiver by either party hereto at any time or any breach by the other party
hereto of, or compliance with, any condition or provision of this Agreement to be performed by such other party shall be deemed a waiver of similar or dissimilar provisions or conditions at the same or at any prior or subsequent time. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14. <B>Validity.</B> The invalidity or unenforceability of any provisions of this Agreement shall not
affect the validity or enforceablity of any other provision of this Agreement, which shall remain in full force and effect. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15.
<B>Arbitration.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Arbitration shall be the exclusive and final forum for settling any disagreement, dispute, controversy or claim
arising out of or in any way related to (i)&nbsp;this Agreement or the subject matter thereof or the interpretation hereof or any arrangements relating hereto or contemplated herein or the breach, termination or invalidity hereof; or (ii)&nbsp;the
provision of or failure to provide any other benefits upon a Change of Control pursuant to any other employment agreement, bonus or compensation plans, stock option plan, stock ownership plan, stock purchase plan, life insurance plan or similar plan
or agreement with the Company and/or any of its subsidiaries as Change of Control may be defined in such other agreement or plan, which benefits constitute &#147;parachute payments&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code. If this
Section&nbsp;15 conflicts with any provision in any such compensation or bonus plan, stock option plan, or any other similar plan or agreement, this provision requiring arbitration shall control. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules (the &#147;Arbitration Rules&#148;) of the American
Arbitration Association (the &#147;AAA&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) The arbitral tribunal shall consist of one arbitrator. Except as otherwise provided in
Section&nbsp;8, the Company shall pay all the fees, if any, and expenses of such arbitration. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) The arbitration shall be conducted in
San Jose or in any other city in the United States of America as the parties to the dispute may designate by mutual written consent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)
Any decision or award of the arbitral tribunal shall be final and binding upon the parties to the arbitration proceeding. The parties hereto hereby waive to the extent permitted by law any rights to appeal or to review of such award by any court or
tribunal. The parties hereto agree that the arbitral award may be enforced against the parties to the arbitration proceeding or their assets wherever the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) The parties stipulate that discovery may be had in any such arbitration proceeding as provided in Section&nbsp;1283.05 of the California Code of
Civil Procedure, as may be amended or revised from time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">16. <B>Counterparts.</B> This Agreement may be executed in one or more
counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original but all of which together will constitute one and the same instrument. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">17.
<B>Withholding of Taxes.</B> The Company may withhold from any amounts payable under this Agreement all federal, state, city, or other taxes as shall be required pursuant to any law or government regulation or ruling. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18. <B>Nonassignability.</B> This Agreement is personal in nature and neither of the parties hereto
shall, without the consent of the other, assign or transfer this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder, except as provided in Section&nbsp;11 above. Without limiting the foregoing, your right to receive payments hereunder, shall not be
assignable or transferable, whether by pledge, creation of a security interest or otherwise, other than by a transfer by will or by the laws of descent and distribution and in the event of any attempted assignment or transfer contrary to this
Section the Company shall have no liability to pay any amounts so attempted to be assigned or transferred. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">19. <B>No Right to
Employment.</B> Nothing in this Agreement shall confer on you any right to continue in the employ of the Company, or interfere with or restrict in any way the rights of the Company, which are hereby expressly reserved, to discharge you at any time
for any reason whatsoever, with or without cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">20. <B>Miscellaneous.</B> No agreements or representations, oral or otherwise, express
or implied, with respect to the subject matter hereof have been made by either party which are not set forth expressly in this Agreement. This Agreement shall not affect your rights under any pension, welfare or fringe benefit arrangements of the
Company under which you are entitled to receive any benefits. The validity, interpretation, construction and performance of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware. The provisions of this Agreement, and any payment
provided for hereunder, shall not reduce any amounts otherwise payable, or in any way diminish your existing rights, or rights which would accrue solely as a result of the passage of time, under any employment agreement or other contract, plan or
agreement with the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">21. <B>Complete Agreement</B><B>.</B> This Agreement sets forth the entire agreement of the parties hereto in
respect of the subject matter contained herein and therein and supersedes the Prior Agreement and all other prior agreements, promises, covenants, arrangements, communications, representations or warranties, whether oral or written, by any officer,
employee or representative of any party hereto, and any prior agreement of the parties hereto in respect of the subject matter contained herein, including without limitation, any prior severance agreements, any contrary or limiting provisions in any
Company equity compensation plan. This Agreement shall not limit in any way any obligation Executive may have under any other agreement with or promise to the Company relating to confidentiality, proprietary rights in technology or the assignment of
interests in any intellectual property </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If this letter correctly sets forth our agreement on the subject matter hereof, kindly sign and return to
the Company the enclosed copy of this letter which will then constitute our agreement on this subject. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.18
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>dex1018.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES, INC. DEFERRED INCOME ACCOUNT PLAN, AMENDED AND RESTATED
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. Deferred Income Account Plan, amended and restated</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.18 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>D<SMALL>EFERRED</SMALL> I<SMALL>NCOME</SMALL> A<SMALL>CCOUNT</SMALL>
P<SMALL>LAN</SMALL> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>A<SMALL>MENDED</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> R<SMALL>ESTATED</SMALL> </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>E<SMALL>FFECTIVE</SMALL> <SMALL>AS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> J<SMALL>ANUARY</SMALL>&nbsp;1, 2008 </B></FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>DEFERRED INCOME ACCOUNT PLAN </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RECITALS </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of California (the &#147;Company&#148;),
previously established the Advanced Micro Devices Inc. Executive Investment Account Plan, effective July&nbsp;1, 2000 (the &#147;Prior Plan&#148;), to provide deferred compensation benefits to the Company&#146;s U.S. employees; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, the Company has determined that it is required to amend and restate the Prior Plan&#146;s terms to comply with certain changes in law resulting
from the enactment of Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;), and to make certain additional administrative changes; and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, the Company caused this Advanced Micro Devices Inc. Deferred Income Account Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), which will be effective January&nbsp;1,
2008, to be prepared to document the amendment and restatement of the Prior Plan&#146;s terms to satisfy the applicable requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A with regard to amounts that are not classified as &#147;Grandfathered Benefits&#148;
(defined below) and intends that the Plan be interpreted and administered in accordance with Code Section&nbsp;409A and any regulatory guidance issued thereunder; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">NOW THEREFORE, the Company hereby amends and restates the Prior Plan in its entirety as follows with no interruption in time, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2008, except as otherwise indicated herein: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE I. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>DEFINITIONS AND
CONSTRUCTION </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>1.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B><U>Definitions</U></B>. Where the following words and phrases appear in the Plan, they shall have the respective meanings set forth below, unless their context clearly
indicates to the contrary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(a)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Account</U></B>: A Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and Company Contribution Account, if any. The amounts credited to the Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and his
Company Contribution Account shall be segregated and separately accounted for as follows: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U><I>Grandfathered Benefits Subaccount</I></U>. The portion of a Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and Company Contribution Account, as applicable, which holds amounts credited
to such accounts for Plan Years beginning prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005 (the &#147;Grandfathered Benefits&#148;). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- 1- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U><I>409A Benefits Subaccount</I></U>. The portion of a Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and Company Contribution Account, as applicable, which holds amounts credited to such
accounts for Plan Years beginning on and after January&nbsp;1, 2005 (the &#147;409A Benefits&#148;). At the direction of the Committee, the Plan shall establish a separate 409A Benefits Subaccount for each Plan Year beginning on and after
January&nbsp;1, 2005, which shall hold the total of amounts credited to a Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and Company Contribution Account for the applicable Plan Year. In this regard, amounts contributed from Bonus payments earned during a Plan
Year will be held in the subaccount established for such Plan Year, even though such amounts may actually be paid during the immediately following Plan Year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(b)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Base Salary</U></B>: A Participant&#146;s annual base salary including commissions but, excluding bonus, commissions, profit sharing, incentive and all other remuneration for
services rendered to Company and prior to reduction for any salary contributions to a plan established pursuant to Code Section&nbsp;125 or qualified pursuant to section Code Section&nbsp;401(k). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(c)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Beneficiary or Beneficiaries</U></B>: The person or persons, including a trustee, personal representative or other fiduciary, last designated in writing by a Participant in
accordance with Section&nbsp;8.4. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(d)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Board</U></B>: The Board of Directors of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. Where applicable, the Board shall refer to the Compensation Committee of the Board to which authority to
oversee this Plan has been delegated by prior resolution of the Board. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(e)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Bonus</U></B> shall mean bonuses paid under the incentive plans listed on Exhibit A, as such Exhibit may be revised by the Committee from time to time.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(f)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Code</U></B>: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(g)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Committee</U></B>: The Administrative Committee of Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., as appointed by the Board to administer the Plan in accordance with Article X, and/or its
agents, designees and vendors. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(h)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Company</U>: </B>Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of California. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(i)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Company Contribution Account</U></B>: The bookkeeping subaccount maintained by the Company for each Participant that is credited with an amount equal to the Company
Discretionary Contribution Amount, if any, and Company Matching Contribution Amount, if any, each as permitted pursuant to Article III, and earnings and losses on such amounts credited or debited pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.3.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(j)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Company Discretionary Contribution Amount</U></B>: The discretionary amount, if any, contributed by the Company for each Participant for a Plan Year. Such amount may differ
from Participant to Participant both in amount and as percentage of Compensation. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- 2- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(k</B>)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Company Matching Contribution Amount</U></B>: The discretionary amount, if any, contributed by the Company as a matching contribution for each Participant for a Plan Year.
Such amount may differ from Participant to Participant both in amount and as percentage of Compensation. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(l)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Compensation</U></B>: A Participant&#146;s Compensation includes Base Salary and Bonuses earned by the Participant for services rendered to the Company during a Plan Year.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(m)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Compensation Deferral</U></B>: Amounts contributed to the Plan from a Participant&#146;s Base Salary and/or Bonus. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(n)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Compensation Deferral Account</U></B>: The bookkeeping subaccount maintained by the Company for each Participant to which is credited a Compensation Deferral pursuant to
Section&nbsp;3.1, and earnings and losses on such amounts credited or debited pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.3. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(o)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Distributable Amount</U></B>: The balance in the Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and Company Contribution Account. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(p)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Early Distribution</U></B>: An election by a Participant in accordance with Article VII to receive a withdrawal of amounts from his Grandfathered Benefits Subaccount prior to
the time at which such Participant would otherwise be entitled to such amounts under his existing distribution elections. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(q)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B><U>Effective Date</U></B>: January&nbsp;1, 2008, except as otherwise provided herein. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(r)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Election Period</U></B>: The period prior to each Plan Year during which the Committee will accept election to defer compensation under this Plan&#146;s terms.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(s)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Eligible Employee</U></B>: An Employee of the Company whose position is at the director, vice president <B>[</B>or corporate officer<B>]</B> level and is designated by the
Committee as eligible to participate in this Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(t)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Employee</U></B>: Any individual on the payroll of the Company whose wages are subject to withholding for purposes of Federal income taxes and for purposes of the Federal
Insurance Contributions Act. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(u)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>ERISA</U></B>: The Employee Retirement Income Security Account of 1974, as amended from time to time. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(v)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B><U>Initial Election Period</U></B>: The thirty (30)-day period immediately following the date an individual becomes an Eligible Employee. Unless specifically designated
through a contemporaneous resolution of the Committee, an individual who is promoted into a position that causes such individual to become an Eligible Employee based on the eligibility criteria established by the Committee shall not be eligible to
enroll in this Plan until the first day of the following Plan Year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- 3- </FONT></P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Investment Fund(s) or Fund</U></B>: The investment fund(s) designated by the Committee from time to time for the hypothetical investment of a Participant&#146;s Accounts
pursuant to Article V. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Participant</U></B>: An Employee participating in the Plan in accordance with the provisions of Article II. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Plan</U></B>: The Advanced Micro Devices, Inc Deferred Income Account Plan, as amended from time to time. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Plan Year</U></B>: Shall mean initially the twelve (12)&nbsp;consecutive month period commencing January&nbsp;1 of each year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Prior Plan</U></B>: The term Prior Plan shall refer to the Advanced Micro Devices Executive Investment Account Plan, as such plan was defined prior to the adoption of this
restated plan document. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(bb)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Scheduled Withdrawal Date</U></B>: The distribution date elected by the Participant for an in-service withdrawal of amounts from such Accounts deferred in a given Plan Year,
and earnings and losses attributable thereto, as set forth on the election form for such Plan Year. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(cc)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Separation From Service or Separates from Service</U>:</B> The termination of an Participant&#146;s employment with the Company in accordance with the Company&#146;s policies
and procedures which is not an authorized leave of absence (as determined under the Company&#146;s standard leave policies); provided, however, that the Company and the Participant reasonably anticipate that no further services will be performed
after the termination date or that the level of bona fide services the Participant will perform after such date (whether as an employee or as an independent contractor) would permanently decrease to no more than twenty percent (20%)&nbsp;of the
average level of bona fide services performed (whether as an employee or an independent contractor) over the immediately preceding thirty six (36)-month period (or the full period of services to the Company if the Participant has been providing
services to the Company for less than thirty six (36)&nbsp;months). Notwithstanding the preceding, any determination of Separation from Service shall be consistent with the requirements of Treasury Regulations Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(h).
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(dd)</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B><U>Specified Employee</U></B>: The terms &#147;Specified Employee&#148; means (i)&nbsp;an officer of an the Company or any Employer earning more than
$135,000 per year, as adjusted from time to time in accordance with Internal Revenue Service guidelines, (ii)&nbsp;a five per cent (5%)&nbsp;owner of a the Company or any participating Employer, or (iii)&nbsp;a one percent (1%)&nbsp;owner of a
Participating Employer having Compensation from the Company or any participating Employer of more than $150,000, all as determined in accordance with Code Sections 409A and 416(i) and applicable Treasury Regulations issued thereunder. The Company
shall designate those individual Participants who are Specified Employees pursuant to any policy </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">- 4- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:3px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
